forester
part of the DrWhy.AI developed by the MI^2 DataLab 0.1.0
  • Reference

Function for training models

Source: R/forester.R
forester.Rd

Function train automates the whole ML pipelines ....

forester(
  data,
  target,
  type,
  metric = NULL,
  data_test = NULL,
  threshold_na = 0.5,
  remove_outliers = FALSE,
  fill_na = FALSE,
  scaling = NULL,
  num_features = NULL
)

Arguments

metric

string containing name of mertic based on which the model will be selected. Metric shoud be written in small letters

Value

An object of the class forester_model.

References

Explanatory Model Analysis. Explore, Explain, and Examine Predictive Models. https://ema.drwhy.ai/

Examples

# \donttest{
library(DALEX)
data(apartments, package="DALEX")

best_model <- forester(apartments, "m2.price", "regression")

#> Original shape of train data frame: 800 rows, 6 columns
#> percentage of NAs in data_train: 0%
#> percentage of NAs in data_test: 0%
#> Deleting rows with na values in train set. If you want to fill NA values set fill_na argument to TRUE
#> 
#> 
#> |model    |      rmse|        mse|        r2|      mad|
#> |:--------|---------:|----------:|---------:|--------:|
#> |XGBoost  |  20.01395|   400.5582| 0.9994919| 10.95752|
#> |CatBoost |  30.40173|   924.2652| 0.9988276| 15.58672|
#> |LightGBM | 102.18700| 10442.1833| 0.9867541| 57.86294|
#> |Ranger   | 160.05746| 25618.3899| 0.9675031| 94.98343|
# }
